title: Payday 2 fans aren't happy about the game's new microtransactions - Gaming
text: Payday 2 fans aren't happy with the game's new microtransactions.Players can now crack safes full of game-changing loot, but only if they shell out £1.60 for a drill to do the job. © 505 Games Payday 2 Crimewave Edition review: PS4 and Xbox One edition far from the perfect scoreThe game's Steam and Reddit pages have since been flooded with complaints from disgruntled fans.It probably has something to do with comments Overkill made about microtransactions back in 2013."We've made it clear that Payday 2 will have no microtransactions whatsoever (shame on you if you thought otherwise!)" game producer Almir Listo said at the time.On the plus side, the game is currently available for just £3.74 on Steam, which is 75% lower than its regular £14.99 asking price.Payday 2 was originally released in 2013 on PC, PlayStation 3 and Xbox 360. It was ported to Xbox One and PS4 earlier this year.Check out our most anticipated games of October, one of many videos in Digital Spy's dedicated Gaming YouTube channel. Be sure to subscribe!
